mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an6.46:2.1.en: “Take a case where mendicants who practice discernment of principles rebuke mendicants who practice absorption meditation:

an6.46:2.4.pli: Tattha dhammayogā ca bhikkhū nappasīdanti, jhāyī ca bhikkhū nappasīdanti, na ca bahujanahitāya paṭipannā honti bahujanasukhāya bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ.
an6.46:2.4.en: In this case the mendicants who practice discernment of principles are not inspired, and the mendicants who practice absorption meditation are not inspired. And they’re not acting for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.

an6.46:3.1.pli: Idha panāvuso, jhāyī bhikkhū dhammayoge bhikkhū apasādenti:
an6.46:3.1.en: Now, take a case where mendicants who practice absorption meditation rebuke mendicants who practice discernment of principles:

an6.46:3.2.pli: ‘ime pana dhammayogamhā, dhammayogamhāti uddhatā unnaḷā capalā mukharā vikiṇṇavācā muṭṭhassatī asampajānā asamāhitā vibbhantacittā pākatindriyā.
an6.46:3.2.en: ‘They say, “We practice discernment of principles! We practice discernment of principles!” But they’re restless, insolent, fickle, scurrilous, loose-tongued, unmindful, lacking situational awareness and immersion, with straying minds and undisciplined faculties.

an6.46:3.3.pli: Kimime dhammayogā, kintime dhammayogā, kathaṁ ime dhammayogā’ti?
an6.46:3.3.en: Why do they practice discernment of principles? In what way do they practice discernment of principles? How do they practice discernment of principles?’

an6.46:3.4.pli: Tattha jhāyī ca bhikkhū nappasīdanti, dhammayogā ca bhikkhū nappasīdanti, na ca bahujanahitāya paṭipannā honti bahujanasukhāya bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ.
an6.46:3.4.en: In this case the mendicants who practice absorption meditation are not inspired, and the mendicants who practice discernment of principles are not inspired. And they’re not acting for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.

an6.46:4.1.pli: Idha panāvuso, dhammayogā bhikkhū dhammayogānaññeva bhikkhūnaṁ vaṇṇaṁ bhāsanti, no jhāyīnaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ vaṇṇaṁ bhāsanti.
an6.46:4.1.en: Now, take a case where mendicants who practice discernment of principles praise only others like them, not mendicants who practice absorption meditation.

an6.46:4.2.pli: Tattha dhammayogā ca bhikkhū nappasīdanti, jhāyī ca bhikkhū nappasīdanti, na ca bahujanahitāya paṭipannā honti bahujanasukhāya bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ.
an6.46:4.2.en: In this case the mendicants who practice discernment of principles are not inspired, and the mendicants who practice absorption meditation are not inspired. And they’re not acting for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.

an6.46:5.1.pli: Idha panāvuso, jhāyī bhikkhū jhāyīnaññeva bhikkhūnaṁ vaṇṇaṁ bhāsanti, no dhammayogānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ vaṇṇaṁ bhāsanti.
an6.46:5.1.en: And take a case where mendicants who practice absorption meditation praise only others like them, not mendicants who practice discernment of principles.

an6.46:5.2.pli: Tattha jhāyī ca bhikkhū nappasīdanti, dhammayogā ca bhikkhū nappasīdanti, na ca bahujanahitāya paṭipannā honti bahujanasukhāya bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ.
an6.46:5.2.en: In this case the mendicants who practice absorption meditation are not inspired, and the mendicants who practice discernment of principles are not inspired. And they’re not acting for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.

an6.46:6.2.en: ‘As mendicants who practice discernment of principles, we will praise mendicants who practice absorption meditation.’

an6.46:7.2.en: ‘As mendicants who practice absorption meditation, we will praise mendicants who practice discernment of principles.’

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 6.46
5. About Dhammika
By Mahācunda

an9.4:6.1.pli: Saddho ca, nandaka, bhikkhu hoti sīlavā ca lābhī ca ajjhattaṁ cetosamādhissa, na lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
an9.4:6.1.en: A mendicant is faithful, ethical, and gets internal serenity of heart, but they don’t get the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

an9.4:6.6.pli: Evamevaṁ kho, nandaka, bhikkhu saddho ca hoti sīlavā ca lābhī ca ajjhattaṁ cetosamādhissa, na lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
an9.4:6.6.en: In the same way, a mendicant is faithful, ethical, and gets internal serenity of heart, but they don’t get the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

an9.4:6.9.pli: ‘kintāhaṁ saddho ca assaṁ sīlavā ca lābhī ca ajjhattaṁ cetosamādhissa lābhī ca adhipaññādhammavipassanāyā’ti.
an9.4:6.9.en: ‘How can I become faithful and ethical and get internal serenity of heart and get the higher wisdom of discernment of principles?’

an9.4:7.1.pli: Yato ca kho, nandaka, bhikkhu saddho ca hoti sīlavā ca lābhī ca ajjhattaṁ cetosamādhissa lābhī ca adhipaññādhammavipassanāya, evaṁ so tenaṅgena paripūro hotī”ti.
an9.4:7.1.en: When a mendicant is faithful and ethical and gets internal serenity of heart and gets the higher wisdom of discernment of principles, they’re complete in that respect.”

an9.4:8.9.pli: lābhī ca ajjhattaṁ cetosamādhissa, na lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya,
an9.4:8.9.en: They get internal serenity of heart, but they don’t get the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

an9.4:8.13.pli: Evamevaṁ kho, nandaka, bhikkhu saddho ca hoti sīlavā ca, lābhī ca ajjhattaṁ cetosamādhissa, na lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya,
an9.4:8.13.en: In the same way, a mendicant is faithful, ethical, and gets internal serenity of heart, but they don’t get the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

an9.4:8.16.pli: ‘kintāhaṁ saddho ca assaṁ sīlavā ca, lābhī ca ajjhattaṁ cetosamādhissa, lābhī ca adhipaññādhammavipassanāyā’ti.
an9.4:8.16.en: “How can I become faithful and ethical and get internal serenity of heart and get the higher wisdom of discernment of principles?”

an9.4:8.17.pli: Yato ca kho, nandaka, bhikkhu saddho ca hoti sīlavā ca lābhī ca ajjhattaṁ cetosamādhissa lābhī ca adhipaññādhammavipassanāya,
an9.4:8.17.en: When a mendicant is faithful and ethical and gets internal serenity of heart and gets the higher wisdom of discernment of principles,

an4.92:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo lābhī hoti ajjhattaṁ cetosamathassa, na lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
an4.92:1.3.en: One person has internal serenity of heart, but not the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

an4.92:1.4.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo lābhī hoti adhipaññādhammavipassanāya, na lābhī ajjhattaṁ cetosamathassa.
an4.92:1.4.en: One person has the higher wisdom of discernment of principles, but not internal serenity of heart.

an4.92:1.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo na ceva lābhī hoti ajjhattaṁ cetosamathassa na ca lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
an4.92:1.5.en: One person has neither internal serenity of heart, nor the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

an4.92:1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo lābhī ceva hoti ajjhattaṁ cetosamathassa lābhī ca adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
an4.92:1.6.en: One person has both internal serenity of heart, and the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

an4.93:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo lābhī hoti ajjhattaṁ cetosamathassa, na lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
an4.93:1.3.en: One person has internal serenity of heart, but not the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

an4.93:1.4.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo lābhī hoti adhipaññādhammavipassanāya, na lābhī ajjhattaṁ cetosamathassa.
an4.93:1.4.en: One person has the higher wisdom of discernment of principles, but not internal serenity of heart.

an4.93:1.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo na ceva lābhī hoti ajjhattaṁ cetosamathassa na ca lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
an4.93:1.5.en: One person has neither internal serenity of heart, nor the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

an4.93:1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo lābhī ceva hoti ajjhattaṁ cetosamathassa lābhī ca adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
an4.93:1.6.en: One person has both internal serenity of heart, and the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

an4.94:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo lābhī hoti ajjhattaṁ cetosamathassa, na lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
an4.94:1.3.en: One person has internal serenity of heart, but not the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

an4.94:1.4.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo lābhī hoti adhipaññādhammavipassanāya, na lābhī ajjhattaṁ cetosamathassa.
an4.94:1.4.en: One person has the higher wisdom of discernment of principles, but not internal serenity of heart.

an4.94:1.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo na ceva lābhī hoti ajjhattaṁ cetosamathassa na ca lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
an4.94:1.5.en: One person has neither internal serenity of heart, nor the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

an4.94:1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo lābhī ceva hoti ajjhattaṁ cetosamathassa lābhī ca adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
an4.94:1.6.en: One person has both internal serenity of heart, and the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an10.55:7.6.pli: ‘anabhijjhālu nu kho bahulaṁ viharāmi, saṁvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no, abyāpannacitto nu kho bahulaṁ viharāmi, saṁvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no, vigatathinamiddho nu kho bahulaṁ viharāmi, saṁvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no, anuddhato nu kho bahulaṁ viharāmi, saṁvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no, tiṇṇavicikiccho nu kho bahulaṁ viharāmi, saṁvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no, akkodhano nu kho bahulaṁ viharāmi, saṁvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no, asaṅkiliṭṭhacitto nu kho bahulaṁ viharāmi, saṁvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no, lābhī nu khomhi ajjhattaṁ dhammapāmojjassa, saṁvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no, lābhī nu khomhi ajjhattaṁ cetosamathassa, saṁvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no, lābhī nu khomhi adhipaññādhammavipassanāya, saṁvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no’ti.
an10.55:7.6.en: ‘Is contentment often found in me or not? Is kind-heartedness often found in me or not? Is freedom from dullness and drowsiness often found in me or not? Is calm often found in me or not? Is confidence often found in me or not? Is love often found in me or not? Is purity of mind often found in me or not? Is internal joy with the teaching found in me or not? Is internal serenity of heart found in me or not? Is the higher wisdom of discernment of principles found in me or not?’

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 10.55
6. Your Own Mind
Decline

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an10.54:2.6.pli: ‘lābhī nu khomhi ajjhattaṁ cetosamathassa, na nu khomhi lābhī ajjhattaṁ cetosamathassa, lābhī nu khomhi adhipaññādhammavipassanāya, na nu khomhi lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāyā’ti.
an10.54:2.6.en: ‘Do I have internal serenity of heart or not? Do I have the higher wisdom of discernment of principles or not?’

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 10.54
6. Your Own Mind
Serenity
